intro: Scorzonera mariae, commonly known as the Mary's scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the European Alps. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typically blooming in late summer. Scorzonera mariae is known for its edible roots, which have a slightly bitter taste and were historically used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine meadows.
